Instruction: Combine milk, sugar, and vanilla extract in a saucepan and bring to a boil over high heat. Lower the heat to medium-low and cook, stirring constantly, until the milk thickens and takes on a caramel color, which may take about an hour or longer.
Stir in baking soda. Keep cooking until the caramelized milk achieves a pudding-like consistency. Transfer the manjar to a bowl and let it cool completely in the refrigerator.
